toc_entry.title: BUM STEER AWARDS 1983
toc_entry.description: Presenting blazing barbecue, bumbling Bush, blaspheming Baptists, and 118 more of the best of the worst of Texas.

toc_entry.title: GOD’S HAPPY HOUR
toc_entry.description: Every year communities scattered across Texas hold wet-dry elections. Each one pits the forces of fundamentalism against the forces of realism. This is the story of one such election.

toc_entry.title: THE GRAND TOUR
toc_entry.description: Houston’s the ticket to a trip around the world. In that one city you can now eat, shop, drink, and dance across the continents of Africa, Asia, Australia, Europe, and the Americas.

toc_entry.title: TEXAS PRIMER: THE DALLAS MODEL
toc_entry.description: The sweetheart of the Apparel Mart: where she came from and where she's going.

toc_entry.title: THE MAKING OF A CONGRESSMAN
toc_entry.description: Twelve ran, Mike Andrews won. A saga of ambition, money, power, courage, and the nature of urban politics in Texas.

toc_entry.title: NOLO CONTENDERE
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Paul Newman stars as an existential ambulance chaser in The Verdict, a dismal study of law and disorder. Best Friends will alienate you; Heartaches will make you feel good. 48 Hrs. is dirty talk and déjà vu.

toc_entry.title: A MONUMENTAL MAN
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: In The Path to Power Robert Caro brings the Texas of the twenties and thirties to hot, scrubby life, but tries to fit the young Lyndon Johnson into a prefabricated and constricting mold.

toc_entry.title: THE QUIXOTIC THEOTOKOPOULOS
toc_entry.subtitle: Art
toc_entry.description: A spectacular show at the Dallas Museum of Fine Arts reexamines the genius of El Greco.

toc_entry.title: A HOME AWAY FROM HOME
toc_entry.subtitle: Lifestyles
toc_entry.description: Thanks to indulgent parents, many of today’s wealthy kids are disdaining dorms for UT-area condos-and forfeiting what may be the best part of a college education.

toc_entry.title: THE ROAR OF THE CROWD
toc_entry.description: Banned in the schools, school kids in the band.

toc_entry.title: AROUND THE STATE
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to entertainment and events of more than usual interest.

toc_entry.title: REPORTER
toc_entry.description: Two newspapers in search of nothing in particular; a fish story with a happy ending; an eleven-letter word for "crossword puzzle whiz"; the cutting edge of Corpus Christi’s minority politics.

toc_entry.title: STATE SECRETS
toc_entry.description: One giant step for wives; one small step for John Glenn; why oilmen will never rule the world; why the new Texas congressmen won’t either.
